body.div:
March 30, 1916 My dear Mrs. Aldis:
Before I go to business, please let me thank you again for all your kindness and hospitality while I was in Chicago. I am quite aware that it was you who made my visit what it was, and I had not only a perfect time, but a complete rest; and I find myself back at work again with renewed vigour.
Did you see the very nice notice in the “Chicago Evening Post” last Saturday, put in by Llewellyn Jones? It did much to soothe my feelings after “The Tribune” notice.
I am returning your “Park Bench” with many thanks. As I wrote you, I am perfectly delighted with it, and think it will act splendidly. I am also sending you a copy of “Off The Turnpike”, as you requested.
I am as keen as you are about the performance in June, and I am sure our dramatic sketches will take.
Until Sunday, the 8th, then, when I hope to see you at seven o’clock—and please don’t forget to let me know where I am to send the motor for you. Very sincerely yours,
